stream_context.summary: Kaze focuses on the Factory-Cannon stage, repairing missing textures, tweaking a new King Bob-omb boss, adding a breakable wall tied to the Bomb-Cap power-up, optimizing code, and experimenting with a dynamic lighting system.

development_findings.summary: Textures were missing in factorycanon.blend; Kaze asked Biobak to resend them so the stage can compile correctly.
development_findings.quote: Biobak, there’s textures missing in the factorycanon.blend file.

development_findings.summary: A looping alarm will be attached to the rotating cannon props and positioned dynamically so the volume changes with player distance.
development_findings.quote: I’m definitely gonna add a looping alarm sound to this. Makes sense as a sound effect, ’cause it’s dynamically positioned.

development_findings.summary: One gear model rotates on the wrong axis; Kaze flagged it as a bug to fix.
development_findings.quote: The gears obviously have a huge bug with one of them rotating on the wrong axis.

development_findings.summary: King Bob-omb rework: lost hit-flash effect after model update; Kaze restored it by tinting the primitive color to orange and reduced his HP to one.
development_findings.quote: I can change it to 1, but I don’t want to lose the effect… I’ll set his color to orange when he explodes.

development_findings.summary: Boss will now only spawn if the player hasn’t unlocked the Bomb-Cap and will die permanently after defeat.
development_findings.quote: The idea is that he doesn’t spawn if you have the Bomb Cap unlocked, and he dies permanently.

development_findings.summary: A wall rises when a switch is pressed; player must break it with Bomb-Cap bombs. Kaze plans deeper cracks and updated lighting to visually cue bombability.
development_findings.quote: I added this wall here… you’re just gonna have to break the wall.

development_findings.summary: Stage is designed to be completed forwards and backwards; Kaze play-tested the reverse route and considers it fun.
development_findings.quote: I did beat it backwards earlier and I think it’s really fun to beat this stage backwards as well.

development_findings.summary: Implemented a micro-optimization that saves less than half a microsecond but makes code harder to read; Kaze debated its value.
development_findings.quote: Not even half a microsecond, it makes the code harder to read.

development_findings.summary: Cap-switch models show the wrong (red) color; flagged for a later art/logic pass.
development_findings.quote: The cap switches here… the color is red. We need to fix that separately at some point.

development_findings.summary: Experiments with grayscale base textures multiplied by primitive color to create per-room dynamic lighting without new geometry.
development_findings.quote: If I use a grayscale texture and multiply it by primitive color, we get all the lighting effects.

development_findings.summary: Kaze will use the waiting time for Biobak’s reworks to add VFX/SFX polish across the hack.
development_findings.quote: Likely what I’ll do in that time is improve the visual fidelity of things—adding VFX, SFX, stuff like that.

development_findings.summary: Demo content is essentially done; release is gated by three promo videos, targeting late-December 2023.
development_findings.quote: The new demo will be released whenever the video for it is ready… might be December 28th or something.

context_findings.summary: Kaze dislikes certain music genres (called one track "disgusting") and switched the stream soundtrack multiple times.
context_findings.quote: This music is driving me insane… we’re listening to Eurobeat.

context_findings.summary: He jokes about having an 'infinite ego' and is rarely offended by insults.
context_findings.quote: That’s one of the benefits of having literally infinite ego.

context_findings.summary: Kaze has no mobile phone plan because he rarely leaves home and borrows a phone when needed.
context_findings.quote: I don’t go outside. What do I need a phone for?

context_findings.summary: Performed an on-stream autism self-test, humorously concluding he’s 'not autistic except in one category'.
context_findings.quote: I would say I won this test.

context_findings.summary: Considering Twitter monetization as a low-effort income source; regards the algorithm as silly but exploitable.
context_findings.quote: I post 'Guys, I have Twitter Blue' and get like 300,000 views—probably like $3.

context_findings.summary: Received a Manscaped sponsorship email and joked about 'shaving microseconds' in code like shaving hair.
context_findings.quote: Shaving my balls live on video for $2,000… speaking of shaving, I shaved a few microseconds of processing time.

biobak.summary: Needs to supply missing textures for Factory-Cannon and confirm whether wall-gear models should remain or be replaced.
Will decide which level to tackle next; Kaze’s scheduling depends on that choice.
biobak.quote: Do you know which level you want to do next? This is going to affect my decisions in life.

biobak.summary: Tasked with retexturing or animating the bombable wall; warned not to alter its geometry drastically.
biobak.quote: Oh god, yeah, don’t change the geometry, please.

key_stories.title: King Bob-omb 2.0
key_stories.summary: A new model inadvertently removed the classic hit-flash. Kaze recovered the effect, reduced the boss to one hit, and tied its existence to the Bomb-Cap unlock.
key_stories.challenge: Model update broke the orange 'damage' flash and the boss felt drawn-out.
key_stories.process: Searched the material list, identified the missing primitive-color command, re-implemented an orange tint, then changed HP from three to one.
key_stories.outcome: Boss now flashes orange, dies in a single hit, and will not respawn after the Bomb-Cap is obtained.
key_stories.key_quote: I can restore the effect… and then I need to make him die in one hit.

key_stories.title: Breakable Wall & Dynamic Lighting
key_stories.summary: To emphasize Bomb-Cap utility, Kaze added a wall that rises during the fight and must be blown open. He plans textured cracks and room-tinted lighting via a grayscale-multiply shader.
key_stories.challenge: Wall looked bland and didn’t clearly signal that bombs were required.
key_stories.process: Decided to deepen cracks, devised a shader that multiplies grayscale texture by primitive color for ambient lighting, and asked Biobak for texture refinements.
key_stories.outcome: Visual plan approved; Kaze will finish textures off-stream, improving readability and aesthetics.
key_stories.key_quote: I think I also kind of want to add a few cracks… just to make it look more inviting to bomb.

key_stories.title: Demo Release Bottleneck
key_stories.summary: Although gameplay is content-complete, Kaze delays the public demo until three promotional videos are edited and scheduled, aiming for late December.
key_stories.challenge: Marketing assets were not ready despite the game build being stable.
key_stories.process: Outlined release order: a short Saturday video, an editor-produced trailer, and a 'Missing Link' retrospective on Dec 14.
key_stories.outcome: Tentative demo launch window of ~28 Dec 2023, contingent on video completion.
key_stories.key_quote: I’m basically done with it, but there is one video I’m going to release… then after that I can release the demo.
